000001-d-01-04-00-CSP.Narrative: TRAIN HAD STOPPED AT MP 25 ON LEVEL GRADE, DETACHED LOCOMOTIVES AND RUN AHEAD TO MP 28 TO CLEAR SNOWFROM TRACK.  UPON RETURNING TO THEIR TRAIN RE-ATTACHING LOCOMOTIVES AND OBSERVING AIR PRESSURE ON REAR-OF-TRAIN DEVICE RISING TO 66 PSI.,  ENGINEER BEGAN TO PULL TRAIN AHEAD.  TRAIN STALLED AFTER MOVING ABOUT 2300FT., CREW NOTICED REAR OF-TRAIN DEVICE SHOWED MOVING, AND AIR PRESSURE INDICATED 0 PSION LAST CAR.  TRAIN CREW ALERTED MAINTENANCE OF WAY EMPLOYEE WHO WAS ON TRACK WITH A SPEED SWING BEHIND ACCIDENT REPORT CONT.  (00-0001) THEM ON THE DOWNHILL GRADE, THAT A CAR MAY BE MOVING HIS DIRECTION.  THE MAINTENANCE EMPLOYEE SAW A RAIL CAR MOVING HIS WAY, LEFT HIS MACHINE PRIOR TO THE RAILCARIMPACTING IT. A DRAWBAR WAS FOUND TO HAVE BROKEN ON THE WEST END OF THE SECOND FROM LAST CAR IN THETRAIN DUE TO ABOUT A 30% OLD BREAK.  EVEN THOUGH THE BRAKE PIPE PRESSURE HAD RISEN ON THE REAR CARTHE BRAKE SYSTEM HAD NOT RECHARGED SUFFICIENTLY TO CAUSE AN EMERGENCY APPLICATION WHEN THE LAST CARIN THE TRAIN SEPARTED.  THE RESULTING IMPACT DAMAGED THE ON-TRACK SPEED SWING AND DERAILED THE WESTEND OF RAILCAR MP 828163.NoneNoneNone

DE0100263-d-01-24-00-DMVW.Narrative: TRAIN CREW PULLING 10 LOADS OUT OF HOUSE TRACK.  POWER WAS JUST  STARTING BACK ON MAINLINE WHEN CONDUCTOR NOTICED THAT THE 5 CARS HE HAD LEFT ON MAINLINE WERE STARTING TO ROLL AT HIS TRAIN.  CONDUCTORFIRST TOLD ENGINEER TO SPEED UP THINKING HE MIGHT BEAT THE ROLLING CARS.  BUT THIS WAS IMPOSSIBLE AND THE ROLLING CARS HIT THE 4TH CAR BEHIND THE POWER.  THE IMPACT TIPPED OVER THREE CARS AND DAMAGEDTWO OTHERS.  (H211) WAS USED BECAUSE THE CONDUCTOR TOLD ENGINEER TO SPEED UP.  THIS HAD NO BEARINGON THE DERAILMENT HAPPENING BECAUSE THE CARS WOULD HAVE HIT NO MATTER WHAT THEY DID AT THAT TIME.  BUT, BECAUSE HE TOLD THE ENGINEER TO SPEED UP, POWER WAS BEING APPLIED TO CARS WHEN THEY MADE IMPACTWHICH GREATLY ADDED TO DAMAGE/COST OF DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4694-d-01-21-00-WC.Narrative: TRAIN CXETEM, CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 108 EMPTY ORE EMPTY CARS, WAS TRAVELING ON MAIN LINE TRACK IN WASHBURN COUNTY.  THE CREW WAS ROLLING BY RELEASE WHEN THE CONDUCTOR NOTICED SPARKS, KNOCKEDOFF BRAKES AND PROCEEDED TO RIDE CAR INTO STONE LAKE.  CONDUCTOR SAW MORE SPARKS AND HAD ENGINEER STOP MOVEMENT.  HE THEN INSPECTED HIS TRAIN AND FOUND TWO CARS NEAR THE MIDDLE OF THE TRAIN WERE DERAILED.  INVESTIGATION INTO THIS INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE FIRST SIGN OF DERAILMENT WAS AT MILEPOST 387.5.  TRACK DAMAGE WAS FOUND BETWEEN 387.5 TO 389. IT APPEARS THAT HANDBRAKES WERE LEFT ON THE TRAIN WHEN THE CREW PULLED IT OUT THE SIDING CAUSING THE WHEELS TO SLIDE.  A NUMBER OF CARS WERE FOUND WITHFLAT SPOTS AFTER THE DERAILMENT.  HAD THE CREW PROPERLY INSPECTED THEIR TRAIN BEFORE LEAVING THE SIDING, THEY COULD'VE RELEASED THE HANDBRAKES AND PREVENTED THE INCIDENT FROM OCCURRING..NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4695-d-01-30-00-WC.Narrative: WWHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES, THE 0800 EW SWITCH JOB WAS INSTRUCTED TO STOP THEIR MOVEMENT ANDSHOVE BACK ON TRACK 63 TO CLEAR.  THE CREW WAS SHOVING BACK 54 CARS WHEN THE WEST 4 CARS DERAILED AT THE FROG TRACK 60.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CUSHIONING DEVICE AND TAIL HOSEBROKE ON CAR AN 5701 AND WAS DRAGGING BETWEEN THE RAILS.  WHEN THE CREW BEGAN TO SHOVE THEIR TRAIN,TRAIN THE AIR HOSE CAUGHT IN THE FROG ON TRACK60 CAUSING FOUR CARS TO DERAIL.  WHEN THESE CARS DERAILED, THEY STRUCK CARS THAT WERE STANDING ON TRACKS 61 AND 58.  ONE CAR ON TRACK 61 WAS DERAILED ANDONE CAR TRACK 58 SUSTAINED DAMAGE BUT WAS NOT DERAILED...NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4690-d-01-04-00-WC.Narrative: THE CONDUCTOR LINED SWITCH OUT OF 57 TRACK AND ALL OTHERS SWITCHES WERE LINED, INCLUDING THE CROSSOVER FROM MARSHLINE TO FVR MAIN.  THE CONDUCTOR HAD STAYED AT LAKESHORE DRIVE TO DO A ROLL-BY INSPECTION OF THE TRAIN.  WHILE FDBOC-3 WAS LEAVING, T045-03 WAS ARRIVING ON FVW MAIN TO 52 TRACK.  FDBOC-3DERAILED WHILE THE TRAINS WERE PASSING EACH OTHER IN THE VICINITY OF THE CROSSOVER SWITCHES. BOTH TRAINS WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND WERE STOPPED.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT REVEALED THE LEAD WHEELOF GATX 22021 HAD PICKED THE FACING POINT SWITCH OF CROSSOVER CAUSING THE SWITCH POINTS TO MOVE PARTIALLY OVER TO THE DIVERGING POSITION.  WHEN THIS CAR DERAILED IT PULLED THE FOLLOWING 2 CARS OFF ANDTHE CARS SIDESWIPED 3 CARS ON T045-03 AS IT PASSED ON THE ADJACENT TRACK.  NO CARS HAD DERAILED ONT045-03.  IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE SWITCH WAS LINED FOR STRAIGHT TRACK MOVEMENT BY SOMEONE PREVIOUS TO THE MOVEMENT OF FDBOC-3 AND THEY FAILED TO PROPERLY SECURE THE SWITCH.  FDBOC-3 DERAILED WHILEPROCEEDING OVER THE SWITCH WHEN IT OPEN UNDER THE MOVEMENT OF THE TRAIN.  THE INVESTIGATION COULD NOT PINPOINT AN INDIVIDAL RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS ACT. IT WAS FELT THAT IT POSSIBLY COULD HAVE BEEN THE SECTION CREW THAT HAD BEEN OUT THERE CLEANING SWITCHES AND THEY JUST FAILED TO PROPERLY LATCH IT WHENDONE.  NO HUMAN FACTOR WAS SENT TO ANY EMPLOYEE AS IT WE ARE NOT ABLE TO DETERMINE THE PERSON OR PERSONS THAT WERE RESPONSIBLE..

G4693-d-01-06-00-WC.Narrative: TRAIN LO26 CONSISTING OF 3 LOCOMOTIVES AND 47 LOADS, WAS SWITCHING AT KIEL, WISCONSIN WHEN THEY PLACED CAR - UTLX 41088 - ON THE MAIN LINE. THE CREW THEN PROCEEDED TO SHOVE LOADS TO THE WEST END OF THE SIDING AND WAS COMING OUT WITH THE CARS WHEN UTLX41088 STARTED TO ROLL EAST AND RAN INTO THE SIDE OF THEIR TRAIN. THERE WAS NO TRACK DAMAGE REPORTED IN THIS INCIDENT.  APPROXIMATELY 133 PEOPLE WERE EVACUATED FROM THE AREA FOR ABOUT 6-7 HOURS.  THE CREW WAS TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
